title: Drawing, "Design after Two Paintings after Caravaggio; Verso, Eagle", 1812–14
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Sketchbook page: folio 98. Classical scene showing assembly; inscription: Polidoro da Caravaggio Roma. Four brothers of Joseph consider throwing him into pit. Surrounded by mountainous landscape; inscribed: Rafaello Perugia. Inscribed at left bottom, corner: 96; and at left top corner: 160. Verso: Eagle show at top. Cow shown at bottom of page; it crouches behind elevation of earth.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design after Two Paintings after Caravaggio; Verso, Eagle", 1812–14.
1812–14. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over traces of graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1347.
